metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9048 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
libxml2 20904-GITv2.9.4-16-g0741801 is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow. The function xmlSnprintfElementContent in valid.c is supposed to recursively dump the element content definition into a char buffer 'buf' of size 'size'. At the end of the routine, the function may strcat two more characters without checking whether the current strlen(buf) + 2 < size. This vulnerability causes programs that use libxml2, such as PHP, to crash.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9048` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxml2 - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.3
libxml2-utils - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.3
python-libxml2 - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libxml2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.3').
